place: Via S. Nicolo 30, II, Trieste, Austria
author: James Joyce
text: Dear Sir I have read with regret in the ‘Standard’ of a week or so back that you are in money difficulties at present. I shall be glad if you will send me back the manuscript of my verses if there is no longer a possibility of your printing them. I hope you will excuse me for troubling you about such a matter but I want to try to have my verses published this autumn. Faithfully yours Jas A Joyce P.S. The MS ‘Chamber Music’ was given to you by Mr Symons in September last.
